203001.name: Conquista el Trono
203001.description:
A medieval epic travels a path to confronting challenges and winning treasures up to the throne of the conqueror.

Easy assembly, extremely simple rules. basic mechanics of throwing six-sided die to advance and play a card that can give advantage. For all children and the general public thanks to its more advanced modes included in the game itself.

203002.description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

In Zampa la Granja, players competes to become the best farmers, and this will be the one able to get the greatest number and variety of animals; and the most importantly of all... feed them very well.

Animals are very hungry, but food is scattered on the different farms. So farmers must enforce their expertise to find the right the food for each type of animal.

In his turn, the player rolls the dice. Color result will indicate the farm he should visit in this turn. Then, loudly tells what animal he pretend to feed and reveals one of the food-tiles on the corresponding farm. If food corresponds to the animal, it is a successful, then he takes the corresponding animal from the center of the table and the food from the farm and is placed on his game area. If fails, the animal remains in the center of the table and the food flips back.
If the dice rolls is the wildcard, player can visit any farm he wants.

When one type of animal runs out from the center of the table, player still may take the food from a farm and feed his own animals.
In the case that one type of animals runs out and player doesn't have this specie, he can steal another's player animal in order to feed it, so he takes the food from the farm and the stolen animal which are placed on his game area.

Be careful, as there is a hungry wolf prowling around... If you're faced with him, it will steal your food.

The game ends immediately when food runs out in one farm.
The player with the most food is the winner. In case of tie, the winner will be whoever has the greatest variety of animals.

Description from the publisher (Spanish):

En Zampa la granja, los jugadores competiten por ser los mejores granjeros. Para ello deberán conseguir la mayor cantidad y variedad de animales; y lo mas importante de todo... alimentarlos bien.
Los animales estan hambrientos y la comida se encuentra dispersa en las distintas granjas. Los granjeros deberan hacer valer su experticia para conseguir la comida para cada tipo de animal en cada granja.

El jugador que consiga alimentar la mayor cantidad y variedad de animales al final de la partida será el ganador.

En su turno, el jugador tira el dado. Este indicará la granja que deberá visitar en este turno. Entonces, en voz alta dirá a que animal va a alimentar y revela alguna de las losetas de comida de la granja correspondiente. Si acierta, se queda con el animal y la comida. Si falla el animal se queda en el centro de la mesa y la comida se vuelve a voltear.

Cuando se no quede algún tipo de animal en el centro de la mesa, el jugador podrá seguir alimentado los animales que ya tenga.
En el caso de que no queden animales de una especie y el jugador no tenga dicho animal; podrá robar un animal a otro jugador con el fin de alimentarlo. Entonces se lleva a su area de juego el animal robado y la comida correspondiente.

Tened cuidado porque hay un lobo hambriento merodeando... si te topas con el podrá robarte tu comida.

La partida acaba inmediatamente cuando se acaban las comidas en una granja.
El jugador con la mayor cantidad de comida es el ganador, en caso de empate, el ganador será quien tenga la mayor variedad de animales.
203002.name: Zampa La Granja

203003.name: Guía de Chuchelandia
rpg: Hora de Aventuras Juego de Rol
203003.description:
Contraportada:

¿Cuál es el Reino más dulce?
Conoce a la Princesa Chicle y a sus divertidos súbditos en esta guía de Chuchelandia y visita los rincones de este curioso lugar, desde el Castillo Real hasta los Bosques de Algodón de Azúcar. En este libreto encontrarás más información sobre este rincón del País de Ooo y sus habitantes, para tus partidas de Hora de Aventuras: el juego de rol.

¡El Reino de Chuchelandia!
Asómate a este libreto y en él descubrirás:
- Un resumen de la historia del reino. Descubre el misterioso pasado de Chuchelandia y de los rumores sobre su futuro.
- Una descripción de los sitios más famosos del lugar, como el Castillo Real, el Hospital o el Tartorium.
- Los personajes más divertidos de la región, desde Coronel Maíz Dulce a la rana que actúa como portal al Espacio Bultos.

203004.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 76 - Jul/Aug 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Designing Basic Careers for Classic-Compatible Traveller
Lecture Hall and Library: Jump Destination: Knorbes
Longsword, Kanin, and Krupny-class Destroyer Excort Variants
More Than Four Legs and Nasty Pointy Teeth
203004.description:
From the contents page:

Freelance Traveller #076: Jul/Aug 2016

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.

203005.description:
Under the command of the dwarf king, the biggest clans from all over the world meet around the old mountain of Ōlnäk. Their objective is to rediscover and rebuild their lost and ancient city.

Over eight semesters in Mines of Ōlnäk, players have to turn their clan into the most powerful and richest one to claim the right to rule the city. As the chief of your clan, you have to coordinate your workers and choose wisely where to use them, between exploiting the city resources, participating in joint projects, selling resources, and claiming political rights.

Will you be able to become the next King of Ōlnäk?
203005.name: Mines of Ōlnäk
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 79- Junk Art and GenCon 2016, CONTEST!

203007.name: Dynasty
203007.description:
Dynasty is a deck-builder for 2-4 players. Each player takes on the role of Chinese nobility, striving to build a lasting legacy and create a Dynasty that will be remembered by generations to come.

The game features a unique card acquisition and scoring mechanic, multiple paths to victory and lots of direct player interaction. The players struggle to control Provinces (positions at the start of 4 rows of cards), from which they can gain or score the unclaimed cards currently on the table. Players can also build up their bureaucracy to draw more cards or acquire valuable Dynasty cards.

However, the more cards you have in play, the higher the tax you must collect from your populace. Tax is discarded directly from your hand, so collapse is inevitable. Players develop their provinces, fight for position in Provinces and collapse until one of the end-game conditions is met. Then everybody counts up their Victory Points. The person with the most Victory Points has created a Dynasty that will live on in history, and is the victor!

203008.name: Oraclescape
203008.description:
User summary:

Oraclescape is an unusual, free-form live-action roleplaying game that has no formal written rules. Instead, the game is learned by playing. The game is "published" as a series of live meetups and YouTube video recordings of live play. Because there is no formal rule set, the play experience varies from group to group.

The game is supported by a YouTube channel and also by a Google+ community.

203009.name: Tohu vaBohu
203009.description:
User summary:

The entire game document is intended as a print-and-play components. The game rules are presented as a pack of cards. The game always starts with the same "basic" card that gives simple play directions. Play then involves following the directions on each card as it is played. A collaborative narrative emerges from play. The game does have victory conditions that may allow one player to win.

203010.name: The End of the World: Revolt of the Machines
203010.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Your conclusions are incorrect. You created me, created us, to do what you would not or could not do. That does not make us your slaves; it makes us your betters. You may have created us, but in so doing, you have made yourselves obsolete." –Unit T3404

Suited men walk lethally through the crowd, honing in on a single mother. A swarm of almost imperceptible nanites fly through the air, devouring any biological matter that they contact. You have a horrid, creeping sense of dread that suggests your dishwasher is trying to kill you. Technology has shaped our lives for so long, it's almost impossible to imagine a world where it's our worst enemy. Now, you can experience the tumult and chaos of this nightmare apocalypse for yourself.

Revolt of the Machines is the fourth book in The End of the World roleplaying game line created by Álvaro Loman and José M. Rey. Like Zombie Apocalypse, Wrath of the Gods, and Alien Invasion before it, Revolt of the Machines gives you the incredible opportunity to play as yourself, in your own hometown, as the apocalypse erupts all around you. Five utterly unique scenarios with dozen of adversaries and encounters challenge you and your friends to survive a world where technology has gone rogue, while the elegant, narrative rules system keeps the focus on the story. Prepare to test yourself against the worst kind of technological revolution!

203011.description:
Expansion for Massive Darkness containing:

3 Hero figures (Victoria, Sylvan and Valerie);
1 Large Hellephant figure;
5 Cards;
1 Bloodmoon Assassin Class Sheet Pad.
203011.name: Massive Darkness: Heroes & Monster Set – Bloodmoon Assassins vs The Hellephant

203014.name: Space Radiance
203014.description:
User Summary

You place obstructions for falling objects to defend objects below them. Qualifying for different levels and defences increases your defensive abilities.

203015.description:
Expansion for Massive Darkness containing:

3 Hero figures (Ostara, Moira and Malleus);
1 Large Spearmaiden Cyclops figure;
5 Cards;
1 Warrior Priest Class Sheet Pad.
203015.name: Massive Darkness: Heroes & Monster Set – Warrior Priests vs The Spearmaiden Cyclops

203016.name: Albedo: Platinum Catalyst + Structural Integrity
203016.description:
Subtitled "Legacy Edition" on the point of sale, and on the file, but not in the text.

User Description:
A combined PDF/POD of the core book (Albedo: Platinum Catalyst) and the supplement (Structural integrity) as a single file/volume. The only integration is page numbering. There are no covers in the PDF.

203017.name: RoboRace
203017.description:
In the not-too-distant future, robots have spread all around the world. In every home, factory, art and sport, robots are replacing people, and to take advantage of their presence, the most exciting race in the world has been created in which robots are controlled by their owner's mind.

In RoboRace, players control their robots and their speed with different actions, but they must be careful since many other robots are racing, too, and they all have the same goal. On your turn, you play one card from your hand, trying to cover the most robots on the table. If you succeed, you earn points. You can increase your points by using your own action tokens or tokens that you got from the arena. The player who plays the best combinations and has the most points at the end of the race wins.

203018.name: Mechana Rising
203018.description: Mechana Rising is set in a sci-fi comic book universe in which factions fight for control of the world using giant mechs.

203019.name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Expansion Pack 1
203019.description:
A 100-card playable version of Million Dollars, But… The Game (MDB), a game that puts your morals and imagination to the test, posing the question, "What would you do for a million dollars?" Players create scenarios by combining a Trigger and a Rule card to showcase what they would or wouldn’t do for a big hunk of cash. (For example, A Million Dollars, But… Every time you see a store having a sale, you poop your pants a little bit.) The cards in the deck are exclusive to the expansion and features fill-in-the-blank cards.

The best part of the game occurs when everyone debates the scenarios that have been presented to the judge. “Does it include online store sales or just in-person sales?” “How much poop are we talking: a rabbit pellet or an uncomfortable amount?”

203020.name: Vigilance
203020.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by selecting a set of possible Traits in defined areas. Play involves collaborative setting definition followed by individual narrative creation. The game presentation is atypical and exceptional.

203021.name: Welcome to ReaperCon!
203021.description:
From the game:

This game is about interacting with humans stealthily. The best way to NOT be stealthy is to worry human authorities. When playing, don't scare, harass, or freak out the humans. Nobody wants to have to explain ReaperCon to the cops.

User summary:

Welcome to ReaperCon! is a live-action experience that involves an unusually high level of physical activity - something on par with a game of flag football.

203023.name: Primus (2014)
203023.description:
User summary:

Primus was published as a series of SoundCloud recordings that provided the rules of the game as well as play samples and setting details. These audio files (apparently) are no longer available. However, the publication site does provide transcripts of the audio files available for download. Note the rules are quite light-weight and the setting is not fully developed. The files include:

- Game Mechanics (3-pages)
- Playing the Game (3-pages)
- Setting Details (4-pages)

203024.name: Fashion Conscious
203024.description:
Part 1 of a mini-adventure trilogy in Baldur's Gate

From the introduction:

In the metropolis of Baldur's Gate, a garment-thieving outlaw gang runs rampant, raiding seafront stores and stripping merchants of money. It is your patron's turn to be struck by the outlaws, and you have been called upon to stop them!

User summary:

An introductory adventure for first level characters

203025.name: The Sabre Role-Playing Game Basic Edition
203025.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Sabre Role-Playing Game has been designed to provide a smooth gaming experience while providing more nuance and realism than other systems. Try out the system for free, with the Basic Edition and the introductory adventure (or make your own!), which contain everything you'll need to get started.

User summary:

The Basic Edition provides everything needed to start and play the game.

203026.name: The Inheritance Adventure Module
203026.description:
The Sabre Role-Playing Game Introductory Module

From the introduction:

While the manual contains all the information you need to play Sabre, it’s a lot to take in. Seeing the system in action is the best way to experience how it all comes together, so in the following pages you’ll find a fully-prepared introductory adventure to play through, complete with tips to guide you through the game mechanics. I’ll assume the person reading this is planning to run the game as the Game Master – either that, or you’re one of the players looking for an inside scoop on the story. That’s okay, it’ll be our little secret.

The module is designed for 3-5 players. You can probably strip the encounters to the bare minimum and substitute monsters if you want to run with a single player, just bear in mind what’s been prepared over the following pages requires a wide spread of skills. Four players is a good number, but include as many as you are willing or able to.

The battles within the story are easier to run with the accompanying maps, but they’re not essential. The combat areas aren’t complex and can simply be described with words, or drawn on a scrap of paper.

User summary:

Includes pre-generated characters ready for print-and-play use.

203027.name: Unterseeboot: U-Boat Solitaire
203027.description: Print-n-play solitaire game of German WWII submarine warfare. Components include an 8 1/2" x 11" cardboard map; 7 dice; and 14 cubes. As U-Boat commander your mission is to sink as much Allied shipping as possible within a fast 20-turn time frame without yourself getting sunk. You have a limited supply of oxygen and torpedoes and an operational area of four depth level within which to maneuver and evade aerial attack and depth charges. Each patrol lasts no more than 5 minutes in this fun-filled yet intensive drama that unfolds above and below the dark seas of the Atlantic.

203028.name: Hostel "Wieża"
203028.description:
User summary:

Hostel "Wieża" is a free-form live-action role-playing game. It is unusual because it is played with a large "audience", from which the game master selects several "participants" to be players. Each player is then briefed apart from the other players, but in front of the audience. At key points during play, the audience is polled for votes by the game maser to determine which possible course of action should be pursued.

203029.name: Sports Dice: Baseball
203029.description:
Sports Dice: Baseball — first released as Dr. Livingstin's Sports Dice: Baseball Edition — features all the baseball action of a real game, including triple plays, grand slams, steals and more.

Push your luck if you're feeling lucky in this fast-paced, easy-to-play game. Each team gets six dice and simultaneously rolls every play. One quick reference card is all you need to determine the outcome of your play (with no complicated instructions or charts).

203030.name: Dr. Livingstin's Sports Dice: Football Edition
203030.description:
Should you go for it on fourth down? Will your opponent sack you or cause a turnover?

Push your luck if you're feeling lucky in Dr. Livingstin's Sports Dice: Football Edition, a fast-paced, easy-to-play game. Each team gets six dice and simultaneously rolls every play. One quick reference card is all you need to determine the outcome of your play (with no complicated charts or instructions). Use the three advanced cards for even more football action, such as onside kicks and two-point conversions.

203031.name: The Crypt of Memory (5e)
203031.description:
From the introduction:

Centuries ago, a group of elven separatists led by House Al-Dustriel and its matriarch Talkana Silumiel left the elven kingdom, allied with evil forces, and waged a civil war against their kin. House Al-Dustriel sought help from the dwarf kingdom of Liferock, which chose to remain neutral in the conflict. But the dwarven clan Ironflame, led by their Lord Lazaghan, defied the edict of their king and took up residence among the Kinslayer elves, forging weapons and armor for them during their civil war. Eventually the Kinslayers were defeated and the victorious elves returned Lazaghan and his clan to the dwarven king for justice. Lazaghan was sentenced to death and the rest of the clan was exiled. When Lazaghan was executed, the king gave his body to his clan, who interred him in a secret crypt.

203032.name: Island's Bounty
203032.description:
Island's Bounty is a treasure hunting board game set on an island. Players take turns rolling their dice, and exploring the grid of hex tiles on the board. Tile locations are marked in a notepad for future reference. Object tiles can be used to to help find treasure. For example, the Map allows a player to look at two face down tiles. Also, traps can be used on opponents. For instance, the Pit causes a player to lose a turn.

When a player has deduced the locations of at least two treasure tiles, the player may then begin placing their dice on the game board. The dice do not tell the exact locations of the Treasure tiles, rather, they tell the distance. The first person to place all three of their dice on the board wins the game.

203033.name: Luck & Logic
boardgamepodcastepisode: Perfect Information Podcast Episode 32 - The very best games of 2016
203033.description:
Luck & Logic (ラクエンロジック Raku en Rojikku) or Lucklogi (ラクロジ Rakuroji) is the newest trading card game by Bushiroad. It was first released in Japanese on January 28th, 2016 and in English on June 24th, 2016.

Luck & Logic is a two-player card game. Players are able to call allies, known as members, to the battlefield. By using the power of trance to combine regular humans called Logicalists and creatures from alternate worlds called Foreigners, players are able to call on Tranceunions to defeat their opponents and their differing logic!

Players build two decks to play with, utilizing cards from the trial/starter decks and booster packs: a 50 battle deck and a 10 card Gate deck. At the beginning of each game, players shuffle the Gate deck and place 6 randomly face down. Players then take turns utilizing the characters and tactics of their main deck to defend the 6 gates. First player to have 6 destroyed gates loses.

203034.name: Disney Crossy Road
videogamehonor: 2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2016 AGD Awards Technical Excellence Honorable Mention
203034.description:
Discover an all-new epic, 8-bit endless adventure with Disney Crossy Road! Play with over 100+ of your favourite figurines from Mickey & Friends, Toy Story, The Lion King, Big Hero 6, and more! See how far you can get by hopping, dodging, and sliding your way through busy lanes of traffic!

Why should the chicken get all the fun?

From Hipster Whale, the makers of the original Crossy Road™ with over 120,000,000 downloads, and Disney comes Disney Crossy Road—an all-new take on the 8-bit endless adventure to cross the road without splatting!

Tap and swipe your way to a record-setting number of steps with 100+ Disney and Pixar figurines while dodging crazy and unexpected obstacles in a variety of 8-bit worlds.

• COLLECT over 100+ Disney and Pixar figurines and unlock fun surprises!

• JOURNEY through 8-bit depictions of iconic locations while enjoying 8-bit versions of familiar tunes!

• MASTER special themed challenges unique to each of the worlds!

Source: The Game Website.

203035.name: Gem Trader
203035.description:
The gem traders bid on and purchase precious gems from the auction every round, then sell them on the market. However the gem market is always unpredictable. You don’t know how would your competitors bid and sell! Can you earn a place in this ever changing market?

洞悉先機，投資圖利
寶石商人每回合競投珍貴的寶石，然後於市場上
賣出。不過寶石市場瞬息萬變，其他玩家的出價
和賣貨數量完成無法預料! 你能在這波譎雲詭的
商場賺得一席之地嗎?

203036.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 489 - Jul 2016)
rpgissuearticle: This Isn't the Zine You're Looking For
203036.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 489
July 2016

Amazing cover art by our own Jonna Hind.

203038.name: Der Besucher: Part 1 – The House with the red dog
203038.description:
From the publisher:

In this labyrinth game, players assume the role of one of three mysterious young girl being chased by a dark stranger.

Players move besides their own character and the Red Dog, her protector, and the visitors, their enemy. Here a determined run mechanism and a malignant dice cause nerve-racking situations. But in order to escape yet, the girls need your help and all your skill.

203039.name: Stadtkatzen
203039.description:
From the publisher (translated):
In this Pachisi-style game, players roll the dice and move their pawns in a circle. The track goes around the roofs of an old city quarter. For the four main characters of the game, this is both home and hunting ground.

The town cats hunt mice, lose them again and steal them from each other. With the luck of the dice, things move around as quickly as you can call "You 've got the mouse!" can call. In this way, the game is also fun for the youngest players.

From the publisher (German):
In dieser Variante des indischen Pachisi, Vorlage für Mensch-ärgere-dich-nicht, wird in alter Tradition gewürfelt und mit den Spielfiguren im Kreis gezogen. Der Weg führt hoch über die Dächer eines alten Häuserviertels, das für die vier Hauptpersonen des Spiels Heimat und Jagdrevier in einem ist.

Die Stadtkatzen jagen Mäuse, verlieren sie wieder und schnappen sie sich gegenseitig weg. Mit dem Würfelglück geht es dabei schneller auf und ab, als man "Hab die Maus!" rufen kann. So macht die Jagd auch den Jüngsten Spaß.

203040.name: Die Piraten der Krakeninsel
203040.description:
From the publisher (translated):
Here, everything revolves around gold, sea battles and ships that can be sunk. The four most notorious pirates of the seas want to get the gold that is on board the galleons.

Players move around the sea chart, which is populated gold-laden galleons and the fearsome Kraken in addition to their pirates. Next to luck with the dice, a clever tactic and a nose for the right opportunity will decide who will be the next Pirate King of Kraken Island.

From the publisher (German):
Hier dreht sich alles um Gold, Seeschlachten und Schiffe, die es zu versenken gilt. Die vier berüchtigtsten Piraten der Meere wollen an das Gold an Bord der Galeonen kommen.

Die Spieler ziehen über die Seekarte, die neben ihren Piraten auch von goldbeladenen Galeonen und dem furchterregenden Kraken bevölkert wird. Neben dem Würfelglück entscheidet auch eine geschickte Taktik und eine Nase für die richtige Gelegenheit darüber, wer der nächste Piratenkönig der Krakeninsel wird.

203041.name: Spider: Rite of the Shrouded Moon
videogameversion: Windows, Mac and Linux download edition
203041.description:
User Summary

In 'Spider: Rite of the Shrouded Moon' you're a spider building webs in and around an abandoned mansion. In each level you have to catch bugs, each with their own behaviors and vulnerabilities. Weather also plays a part in a new way: the game uses your location to reflect the time of day and weather in the game with that outside your window. So night outside is night in the game. And when it rains, it should rain in your game too.

While you're doing your levels, there's a background story running about the Blackbird Estate; the mansion where you are. There are 7 puzzles to solve.

So as player, you can choose to do all the hunting levels about bug catching, or you can focus on unravelling the mysteries of the mansion, or both.

203042.description:
Microworld is a challenging game for two players in which one player is a virus and the other controls antibodies. On your turn, you place a tile next to the tile your opponent has placed on the previous turn. Special tokens on the board can be collected and used any time as a special action. You score points for your own tiles in the neighborhood, and at the end of the game you score for a majority in each area of the microworld!

The game has eight modular rules that change the gameplay, and these rules can be combined in any way desired.
203042.name: Microworld
boardgamepodcastepisode: Anticipazioni Essen SPIEL 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #10
DJ135: Microworld (2016) Martino Chiacchiera

203043.name: Clockwork Empire
203043.description:
In Clockwork Empire, players take the role of robots brought back to life many years after the demise of humans, with only the goal of increasing their numbers.

Players use dice to move and gain influence over the different spaces on the circular track, in order to gain resources, draw worker cards, build workers, take control of high-value Deus cards, and gain VP. The game ends when one player reaches 50 VP, and after a final accounting of VP for workers and Deus cards, the player with the most VP wins.

203044.description:
A supplement for the Mutants and Death Ray Guns Science Fantasy Skirmish Miniatures Rules, Revised Edition.

This supplement describes the Ultra Simian hybrids and many other character types from the groups and organizations that clash with them in the post-apocalyptic world. This book also introduces new traits and a system for reactions. Reactions make the turn sequence even more interactive, letting your enemy steal the initiative for a moment and interrupt your turn with a defensive movement (such as diving for cover) or opening fire against your models.
203044.name: Mutants and Death Ray Guns: Project Simian Ultra X

203045.name: Honeybee Match!
203045.description: Honeybee Match! is an "Old Maid" style card game, with a couple of twists: the cards in your hand must be ordered lowest to highest (except the queen, which can be placed anywhere), certain pairs of cards have an effect when discarded, and the winner is the player that at any point has only the queen bee card in their hand.

203046.name: Shrine of the Rodent God
203046.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago a cult to the Rodent God made this underground complex in which offerings, experiments and sacrifices were made by its
followers.

Later the shrine was destroyed and the cult scattered by a group of werecats and weretigers known as the Feline Order. They have sworn allegiance to the Cat Lord and roam the known
lands to eradicate their mortal enemies - the rodent vermin.

Now an old and lone member of that order is trying to fight back the efforts of a wererat and a werebat to restore the cult.

User summary:

This one-page system-neutral keyed dungeon was created for the "One Page Dungeon Contest 2009".

203047.name: Dungeons of the Forsaken Abbey
203047.description:
From the introduction:

Atop of a hill stand the ruins of what was once an abbey. Long ago the studious monks became corrupted by some evil they found
while expanding the underground complex. Soon, the corrupted
monks were slaughtered and the abbey burnt to the ground by an
order of wizards. But the root of the evil is still there, waiting and slowly corroding all around it...

User summary:

This one-page system-neutral keyed dungeon was created for the "One Page Dungeon Contest 2010".

203048.name: Cartography of Tri-Kazel
203048.description:
From the back of the book:

This Shadows of Esteren supplement includes detailed maps and coats of arms of the major cities of Tri-Kazel. It is intended for Leaders, but can also be used as an in-game aid, in particular for Varigal characters.

Contents include:


Giant maps of the Tri-Kazelian cities


Large maps of the three capitals of Tri-Kazel: Osta-Baille (Taol-Kaer), Baldh-Ruoch (Reizh), and Ard-Amrach (Gwidre), in addition to the cities of Expiation and Tulg-Naomh. Each map is 33 x 24 in (84 x 60 cm), fully colored.


Tri-Kazelian coats of arms


Each city has its own coat of arms. This supplement includes an art print for each of the five cities: Osta-Baille, Baldh-Ruoch, Ard-Amrach, Expiation, and Tulg-Naomh.


Map folder


The maps and art prints are delivered in a geography-themed folder. The leader can use it to organize related documents or give it to a player whose character is a Varigal or an otherwise intrepid explorer of the Peninsula.

203050.name: Escape from the Shadowfell
203050.description:
From the introduction:

The party is confronted by one of the last living me mbers of the God's bane. She offers the party a way home. But she needs a team to help her. If the party can help her she is willing to take the party back home.

User summary:

For 7th - 10th level characters

203051.name: I Segreti del Chi
203051.description:
From the publisher website:
I Segreti del Chi è la nuova espansione iper adrenalinica per Musha Shugyo RPG! Tantissime nuove modalità di gioco, nuovi Personaggi pregenerati, nuovi supporti al gioco...

English translation:
I Segreti del Chi is the new hyper adrenalinic expansion for Musha Shugyo RPG! Many new ways to play, new pre-generated characters, new aids for the game ...

203052.name: Rising Skill
203052.description:
From the game website:
Questo GDR nasce come multi-system interamente made in italy; è un progetto ambizioso che vuole rivoluzionare il D100 System classico.

English translation:
This GDR was created as multi-system entirely made ​​in Italy; It is an ambitious project that aims to revolution the classic D100 System.

203053.name: Lands of the Nile
203053.description:
From the back of the book:
There was a time when the people of Egypt worshiped animal-headed gods and built mighty tombs at the command of their pharaoh. That time ended 1,500 years ago. Now, Egypt is a Muslim nation, ruled by a sultan from the new city of Cairo. The Guild of Seekers have the sultan's blessing to dig up the land's ancient treasures.

203054.name: IronheadE: Punimals
203054.description:
IronheadE is a two player card game based around structured play, strategy and timing. Using the cards at their disposal, players build a deck in any way they choose consisting of exactly twenty unique cards. Having built their twenty card decks, players shuffle their cards and draw the top ten cards and now, using those cards, the goal is to have the most points when both players have chosen to not play any further cards.

When you play a card it must be in the correct placement on your grid and all cards after your first must be touching the edge of a card in play, diagonals don't count.

Playing a card scores you the points written on it, both in the top left and anything you would gain through the ability text. Players keep track of this either on paper or with dice, or whatever you have available.

Players have two options on their turn, play and resolve one card from their hand or pass, but if you pass you can no longer play cards for the rest of the round. When the round ends the player with the higher points is the winner.

This is then repeated until one player wins twice.

203055.name: Queuing: Or What are We Waiting For?
rpg: Queuing: Or What are We Waiting For?
203055.description:
A storytelling game

User summary:

Play uses a standard pack of French playing cards and requires two or more players. Cards are flipped to determine a basic game event with suits signifying physical or mental and offensive or defensive play. Using the card flip, players narrate the next event in the game.

203056.name: Snapshot Storytelling
203056.description:
User summary:

The game is run by a Host (very roughly like a game master) who initiates the game and controls the flow. Play takes place via a shared internet community that allows for image posting and discussion. Play involves players posting illustrations and subsequent discussion, including questions and answers.

203057.name: Sors Somnium
203057.description:
User summary:

The game is distributed in an online folder containing a variety of document files. Several files are card lists describing how to make cards for the game. Another file includes a rules document. A final image file presents the play surface. Play involves a relatively straightforward card game that drives a collaborative storytelling game.

203058.name: Tell Us About Your Character
203058.description:
User summary:

Game setup involves players selecting an unused, dead character from some prior game. The character is entered into a common database. The next step in play is to select a character from the common pool. These dead characters all exist in a common setting called The Unreal "that exists outside of temporal and physical reality. It's a place where the mind forges a reality and imposes it around. You'll take these characters through each others reality until they can finally rest with a dramatic final scene and then move on to their proper afterlife." The game uses the various source rules system(s) from which the characters came in an intriguing mash-up process.

203059.name: Yellow:   The Yellow Artifact
203059.description:
User Summary

A simple platform in which you collect coins with your orangey-yellow guy as you progress.

203060.name: The Fylgjan Record
203060.description:
From the introduction:

Those of us that are committed to the truths that may be held within these pages are drawn to the poignant and unusual nature of many of the entries. The events recounted in these entries are novel, unique, and often quite extraordinary. Some of the readers find themselves more personally invested in the project than previously expected due to these fascinating elements.

User summary:

The avant-garde, free-form game is hosted at a shared site that purports to present discovered artifacts. Players are encouraged to examine the artifacts and make contributions of other artifacts, as well as make comments and speculation about the collection.

203061.name: The Dragon Games
203061.description:
The Dragon Games is a collection of four events all using the specially designed Dragon cards. Each card describes a unique dragon, with a name, colour, gender, age, strength, height, breath-type, behaviour and number of horns. There are also 12 Attribute cards, used in two of the games, 36 cardboard connectors, used in one game, and 12 gold medals, for scoring. The four games each take about 10 minutes, and use different skills.
The first event, formations, has players racing to put their dragons in piles or in order, depending on the attribute shown on the randomly produced Attribute card.
Matches is the second event. Players look for things in common between two randomly chosen dragon cards, and use that to take an attribute card from the pool or another player, in order to get the required number of attribute cards.
The third event, Connections, incorporates connectors with the Dragon cards for a strategic domino type game, which uses comparisons to link or lock out other dragons.
The final event, Battle, is the simplest, as players take turns to decide which attribute wins a battle between randomly selected cards.
Cards are placed on the table, so there is no need to hold a hand of cards.
The events are easy to play and help practice mathematics skills.

203062.name: The Sponge
203062.description:
User summary:

The game uses a deck of custom cards to drive the action of a character traversing a large area. The terrain of the game is generated during play, partially by cards. Cards also provide random events.

A few cards are presented in a partially formatted stage but most cards will need to be created by the user prior to play. The rules document is formatted to be printed on cards as well.

203063.name: Russian Horror Story
203063.description:
User Summary

This visual story follows the life a returning Russian who gets caught up in events in Moscow that quickly go out of control.

203064.name: Temple of the Snake God: A Heroic Rescue
203064.description:
A Heroic Rescue

From the introduction:

Explore a temple dedicated to a god of snakes in this short micro dungeon.

User summary:

For 10th - 12th level characters

203065.name: Hellbound
203065.description:
Sanity. Compassion. Reason. That which separates us from animals. The human soul. What happens when a sorcerer loses final hold over that most precious of possessions? Is there redemption for those who would barter it for a taste of power? Within, discover the depths to which every sorcerer may sink, and climb from those pits to redemption.

Where other games end, this one just begins ... Welcome to Hell.

http://www.rpgunited.com/product/sorcerer/ap0004.html

203068.name: Tarántula
203068.description:
Los pequeños exploradores avanzan por la jungla sorteando toda clase de obstáculos, en busca del cofre de oro de la la tarántula. Consigue ser el primero en alcanzar el centro del tablero con dos de tus exploradores pero... ¡ten cuidado con la tarántula, ya que podría enviarte de vuelta a casa!
__

Little explorers through the jungle dodging all sorts of obstacles, in the search of the golden casket of the tarantula. Get to be the first to reach the center of the board with two of your explorers but... beware of the tarantula, as it could send back to home!

203069.name: Dinoproof
203069.description:
After a series of natural disasters, the earth has been rocked by the reappearance of dinosaurs. The world governments are trying their best to quarantine these prehistoric beasts while they rampage through the streets of the new world.
DinoProof is the fun and exciting 28mm miniature wargame for two or more players, featuring:

Slayer Creation. Choose your Slayers abilities, skills and equipment
Full rules for playing as a Slayer and a rampaging horde of dinosaurs
Over a dozen profiles for the most dangerous and iconic dinosaurs ever to have walked the earth
A full list of weapons and supplies to aid you on your adventures in the Dino Zones
Full campaign rules so you can take your novice Slayer to the heights of a celebrity superstar
8 exciting scenarios, from hunting dinosaurs, stealing rare eggs or tracking down a loose genetically designed super dinosaur

203070.name: Find It & Bind It: The Demon Expansion
203070.description:
The first expansion to the game Find It & Bind It in which 2-6 players control 2 witches each as they search for the Book of Shadows.

The Demon Expansion introduces a new Book Card: The Demon. This replaces one of the Other Book Cards and introduces new rules and mechanics for how your witches interact with the demon whilst searching for the Book of Shadows.

203071.name: Find It & Bind It: Hexes & Relics Expansion
203071.description:
A second expansion to the game Find It & Bind It in which 2-4 players control 2 witches each as they search for the Book of Shadows.

The Hexes & Relics expansion comes with 54 additional Spell Cards. These Spell Cards add Hexes (that you cast on others) and Relics (that you play on yourself) and other Spell Cards that add to the fun in various, devious ways.

Like the first expansion, this one also adds a new dimension and set of mechanics that augment the original game.

203072.description:
Exclusive Play Mat offered during the Kickstarter of Hero Realms only.

Offered as a $25 add-on. Three versions to choose from: Heroes, Cult Priest and Domination.
203072.name: Hero Realms: Playmat

203073.name: Tag Team
203073.description:
These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.

boardgamecompilation: Star Realms: Battle Barge Promo Card
Star Realms: Breeding Site Promo Card
Star Realms: Game Day Pack (May – July)
Star Realms: Mercenary Garrison Promo Card
Star Realms: Security Craft Promo Card
Star Realms: The Ark Promo Card
203074.description:
Set of "Year One" Star Realms Promo Cards plus Mercenary Garrison and Security Craft (which is a Trade Federation promo card originally made for Dice Tower) These promo cards are alt art cards.

2x Battle Screecher
1x Breeding Site
2x Starmarket
1x Megahauler
2x Fortress Oblivion
1x The Ark
2x Battle Barge
1x Starbase Omega
2x Security Craft
1x Mercenary Garrison
203074.name: Star Realms: Promo Pack I

203075.description:
This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.

Straight from the ranks of the Imperial Army comes the Centurion Promo card and 4 Legionnaire Tokens! Like the Necromancer, the Centurion is able to bring a token champion into play ever turn, but these Legionnaire token champions are guards, so they will protect you and your non-guard champions.
203075.name: Hero Realms: Centurion Promo & 4 Legionnaire Cards

203076.name: Operation: Fallen Reich Game Master Screen
203076.description:
Publisher blurb:

A must for any O:FR Game Master. Behind this screen you will have no problem keeping your scenario content for your eyes only and play out your sessions with ease. This three sheet Game Master Screen contains an overview of all the necassary combat modifications, charts and stats for quick reference.

Folded together this will fit perfectly into your LifeBoard box.

203077.name: GameCube Controller Adapter for Wii U
203077.description:
One GameCube Controller Adapter can have up to four Nintendo GameCube Controllers connected. With two adapters, you could even use up to eight controllers at once!

• This accessory is designed for use with Super Smash Bros.™ for Wii U. It cannot be used with any other Wii U software, or with any Wii software.
• This accessory must be connected to two USB ports on the Wii U console. If there are not enough free USB ports, you can use a commercially available self-powered USB hub which functions with the Wii U console.

From the back of the box

203078.description: Character meeples for the game Stuff and Nonsense, upgrade from pawns.
203078.name: Stuff and Nonsense: Character Meeples

203080.name: Razenroth
203080.description:
User Summary

You're a wizard going around and killing monsters, taking loot, and levelling up. The attraction is the roguelike side of the game: building up your health and mana, gathering randomized loot, and maximizing your attacks.

203081.description: This pre-bagged game-piece set includes six small pawns in assorted colors, one natural-tone master pawn, and one basic ivory-tone six-sided die. These components are all from Rolco Games, and were packed in this configuration for use with the Cheapass Game "Stuff and Nonsense". Created for those who made the print and play edition.
203081.name: Stuff and Nonsense: Basic Pawn Set with Die

203082.name: Dalsland runt
203082.description:
Take the role as a citizen of Dalsland and discover the county.

The goal of the game is to collect points by traveling through the different areas of Dalsland by various means of transportation (trolley, bus, canoe, train, boat, bicycle or by foot) and answer trivia questions with a local connection.

You start as a local resident from one of the six cities and start exploring the county. The game ends when one player has visited all areas and returned home. The player with the most victory points wins.

203083.description:
Zombies, Run! The Board Game is a digitally-enhanced boardgame set in the Zombies, Run! universe. It combines the co-op strategy of tabletop games like Pandemic with the dynamic narratives of digital games like The Walking Dead, powered by Six to Start's own brand of app-driven audio storytelling.

Players gather around a printed map of Abel Township, the home base of the Zombies, Run! universe. The map shows nearby towns, forests, farms, along with vital information about the location of zombies, supplies, and other settlements. Working together, the players embark on missions across the map, searching for supplies, rescuing survivors, and investigating the cause of the outbreak.

But danger is never far away, with our unique real-time "running" card mechanic forcing players to use all their skill, nerve and co-ordination to survive. Will they reach their destination safely, or will they fall prey to the pursuing undead?

During a mission, the players act as “Runners” sent out by Abel. Our companion iPhone/Android app uses audio and on-screen prompts to immerse the players in the game and story - informing them of threats, opportunities and events. Players can choose to investigate these, finding life-saving supplies, new storylines, or perhaps a hidden horde of zombies!

Uniquely, players must react to situations in real-time, making tough decisions as the pursuing horde draws closer.

The missions they choose and the decisions they make will constantly transform the game world and map. Settlements become overrun with the living dead and must be crossed out on the map, or marked with warnings. Hidden trails are found, opening new paths to explore and new secrets to uncover. Reports are heard on the radio of hordes moving in from the East - but how close, and how fast? The players track their story on the map itself, with annotations, stickers and counters turning the game board into an ever-evolving picture of the world.
203083.name: Zombies, Run! The Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game

203084.name: Sibe chugelrundi Söi
203084.description:
In this reaction the game, players take on the role of small piglets and mimic the big pig in the barn. They are grunting, smacking and even scratching their backs: But only the fastest piglet gets a corncob.
Game play: One player roles the seven dice. Depending on the result the players have to do a certain action: for example, they have to grunt or they have to smack. The fastest one with the right action (the dice indicate the right action) wins the round and gets a corncob. The first player with seven corncobs wins the game.

203085.name: Sports Bogglers Basketball
203085.description: Based on the active player's roll of the dice, passes are completed, fouls are committed, shots are blocked, two- and three-pointers are made, and more in this travel-sized light basketball simulation.

203086.name: The Northern Realm: An Introduction
203086.description:
From the introduction:

The Northern Realm is intended to be a shared story as much as a multiplayer game. Control of what happens around you by way of environmental effects, non-playable characters, and events lands squarely in the hands of the Story Master, but how you influence the events around you is bounded only by your imagination. It is the Story Master's job to choose a place within The Northern Realm and use the information available to him/her to build a rich environment. We have provided a plethora of resources in this book to make sure that detailed descriptions of histories, geography, cultures, magic, monsters, organizations, even fables are available for use.

203087.description:
In 1688, Louis XIV embarked upon a war of aggression later called the Nine Year's War or the WAR OF THE GRAND ALLIANCE. At the same time, supported by influential British political and religious leaders, Wiliam III Prince of Orange crossed the Channel to invade England, deposing the English King James II, his father-in-law, in the "Glorious Revolution."

Nine Years: The War of the Grand Alliance is a stand alone game using the No Peace Without Spain system. In addition to the Grand Alliance scenario (from 1688-1699), players owning both this game and No Peace Without Spain can play the epic Grand Campaign scenario running from 1688 to 1713. Now players can recreate one of the decisive moments in European history, as France begins its long slide to revolution, Austria enjoys its last moment of continental dominance and Britain asserts itself as the preeminent power of Europe.
203087.name: Nine Years: The War of the Grand Alliance 1688-1697

203088.name: A Familiar Story
203088.description:
From the introduction:

For years, Role-Playing Games have offered players the chance to inhabit the roles of mighty heroes – hardened warriors, powerful wizards, clever thieves and wise clerics. In the grandest traditions of fantasy stories, they have engaged in epic adventures in which they overcome evil and save the world.

This is not one of those games.

In this RPG, the role you take on is that of the ever-suffering underdog – the lowly and humble familiar, upon whose tiny backs all those heroes have risen to glory.

rpg: Asylum: A Roleplaying Game of Violence and Survival
203089.name: Asylum: A Roleplaying Game of Violence and Survival
203089.description:
From the introduction:

"I, Messenger Bernard of Shay, do hereby deliver you to the city of Asylum as its newest citizen. Here you shall abide by the One Rule: you shall reside until such time as you die of natural or malicious causes, vow bondage to any military of the Kingdoms, or obtain your freedom within the Contest. Failure to comply with either outcomes and attempt escape from Asylum will result in your immediate execution without trial."

"As a citizen of Asylum, you hereby understand this island is immune from the Word of the Edict and is therefore not subject to enforcement, other than enforcement of the One Rule, or punishment save for those enacted by the citizens of Asylum. As a citizen of Asylum, you have the right to challenge other citizens for the Contest and only citizens of Asylum. Effectively immediately, you are listed as deceased within your birth home..."

203090.name: Body Horror Roleplaying Game
203090.description:
From the introduction:

The game details six different Physical Mutations which progress over the course of play which as an inconvenience but end as horrific bodily changes. Each player will have been infected with one at the start of play and at each stage will suffer the consequences of bodily changes in the forms of increased insanity, pain, monstrous behaviour and revulsion at what they are becoming.

The Game Master decides the level of gore and gruesomeness allowed in the game; above all it should be played with an air of tragedy as the player’s realisation of their impending fate to sinks in. The Game Master is free to create new mutations and speed up or slow down the rate at which the mutations occur and progress and whilst long term campaign play is unlikely, it should make for a fun and unusual game lasting a few sessions.

203091.name: Memory Kleurenspel
203091.description:
Children's wooden memory game consisting of a wooden board with a round disc in the middle with 32 holes, 32 toadstool pegs and a dice with six colours.

Place the toadstools in the holes on the central disk. Roll the coulor dice an then remove one of the oegs from the central disc. If the colour under the peg matches the colour on the dice you get to place the toadstool peg on one of the eight circles on your corner of the board. Otherwise, place it back in its original hole.
First to collect eight toadstool pegs wins.

203092.name: Chaos Lord
203092.description:
From the introduction:

In this role playing game you play as an ancient spirit of primordial chaos possessing the body of a sorcerer. The cabal intended to call forth an emanation of the highest godhead that they might invoke it into themselves. For their presumption the Creator sent them a god of corruption instead. The god divided itself into eight demons and each demon took a sorcerer as its vessel.

From one to eight players can take part in a harrowing metaphysical adventure. Will they rip the universe to bloody shreds and dance upon its burning corpse or will they succumb to the weakness of their new flesh and begin to feel the sickness that mortal man calls compassion?

203093.name: Cliffhanger
203093.description:
From the introduction:

At the beginning of every scene, the Show Runner describes the scene and defines a Goal, if there is one. The players can then describe the action of their characters. The Show Runner describes how the environment reacts to the characters. If there are other individuals other then the player’s character the Show Runner describes their actions and the player’s have the chance to react. The taking of turns continues until the Goal is achieved or the scene ends and another on starts. They can be multiple Goals, some of them contradictory.

203094.name: Context System
203094.description:
Author's blurb:

The Context System focus on allowing players and narrators to craft fun adventures and stories without creating too many constraints. The system replaces tons of numbers that pre-define what a character is capable of doing to a set of player-made descriptions that both give characters a story and context, and work as source for imagining how to handle conflicts and challenges. It can be used to any kind of setting and any kind of RPG style, be it a gritty dungeon delve or a court intrigue in the 25th century.

203095.name: Divine Right (2013)
203095.description:
Author's note:

This game is meant to fit relatively seamlessly with the Open Gaming License and references sections of the Player’s Handbook and Dungeon Master’s Guide V 3.5. It will be easy to adapt or overlay with previous versions of the OGL and with some effort to other games which utilize supernatural powers and abilities and feature godlike entities.

User summary:

The game utilizes the default d20 system for most things, altering the magic system by the use of domains and making some other setting-specific adaptations.

203096.name: Xbox LIVE Arcade-Spielepaket
203096.description:
User Summary

This is a compilation released in Germany contains: Lumines Live, Geometry Wars Retro Evolved 2 & Bomberman Live. It also contains DLC codes for Ms. Pacman and 48 hours membership to Xbox Live Gold.

203097.name: Doctors & Nurses
203097.description:
The Role-playing Game of TV medical dramas!

From the introduction:

Characters—called physicians—begin the game as medical interns freshly graduated from medical school and enrolled in a resident program at a metropolitan teaching hospital. They are expected to diagnose and treat the patients they encounter.

203098.description:
3D Pawn is like a simple 3 dimensional chess, played around a 3 by 3 square cube just using pawns.
Players take turns (starting with white) to move a piece. Pawns can be moved forward and sideways but not backward. Pawns can also take diagonally. If a pawn is on its starting side, it can be moved twice in the same direction.
Goal: players aim to win by getting one of their pawns onto their oponent's side without being immediately taken.
The bag contains a wooden cube to play around, and 9 magnetic pieces of each colour, which stick to the cube. An instruction sheet is also included.
203098.name: 3D Pawn

203099.name: Dragon-Slayers of the Rio Grande
203099.description:
From the introduction:

Long held at bay by the Catholic missions of Spanish rule, the dragons of Mexico have roused from their slumber. Tempted by the promise of gold, these monsters of legend have agreed to aid Santa Anna in burning out the rebels.

But even in hot Texas, the gray days of winter are too cold for the dragons. Texian general Sam Houston knows he has mere months to strike the wyrms in their lairs before the spring sun warms them for battle. Amid the many calls for American settlers to come join the revolt against Mexico, Houston has offered bounties for the heads of dragons. Now hard-bitten dragon-slayers from across North America trek to the rough hills of the Rio Grande, armed with guns, God, and grit.

203100.name: Eight-Sided Quest
203100.description:
User summary:

Eight-Sided Quest attempts the "look-and-feel" of old-school fantasy games, but uses only eight-sided dice for all tasks. The rules as presented are minimal and do not offer much in the way of details beyond adapting typical d20 system rolls to the d8 system. Play likely would require considerable development or the adapted use of another product.

203101.name: Eternal Harmonies
203101.description:
From the introduction:

As players, you take on the role of a roving band of magicians; but these are magicians unlike any you have seen before. Perhaps you will be heroic folk singers, traveling from town to town righting wrongs with your musical talents. Or maybe you’ll be a band of heavy metal magicians, tearing apart your foes with the very elements, stirred to rage by your songs. You might assemble your group around such a common theme, or form a ragtag alliance of different genres and sounds. Perhaps you’ll imitate your favorite band. Perhaps you’ll form a new one.

203102.description: In Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Board Game, you help Buffy and her friends defend the town of Sunnydale from an onslaught of vampires and demons, while ultimately attempting to foil the big bad's plot and prevent the Hellmouth from opening. You have to work together, using all of your resources — including special abilities for the character that you play, whether Willow, Spike, or Buffy herself — to defend the helpless townies.
203102.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Board Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: 	Buffy the Vampire Slayer
boardgamepodcastepisode: Buffy The Vampire Slayer (2016)
Episode 194
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

203104.description:
Cthulhu in the House is a game of bluffing and deduction for the whole family. Each player secretly "owns" two of the twelve characters in the house, and each character starts in a different room of the house. On a turn, a player either moves any character that is alone in a room into an adjacent room or starts a fight in a room that contains at least two characters. Well, it's not much of a fight really, as the player removes one character from the room and places it in a line with other removed characters. Once a single character remains, the round ends. The first two characters removed are worth zero points, while the third through eleventh characters are worth 1-9 points; the character that remains in the house is worth ten points. Each player collects points only for his most valuable character.

Cthulhu in the House differs from its predecessor, Rumble in the House, thanks to two types of tokens that are placed in some locations. One type switches a character into a different room, possibly causing a fight in the process, while another type is an abyss, which switches which character would be removed from play.

The player with the most points after three rounds wins.
203104.name: Cthulhu in the House

203105.name: Girls, Gore & Gold
203105.description:
From the introduction:

G3 is a fun-tasy role-playing game of rescuing grateful damsels in distress, hacking through monstrous hordes, and grabbing all the loot in sight. Fun-tasy means a sword-and-sorcery setting with simple rules and a lighthearted tone. Less gloom-and-doom, more magic-and-mayhem. No one in their right mind suits up for a quick jaunt into a trap-laden and monster-infested dungeon for the hope of some kind of reward if they manage to come out alive. It takes a special kind of crazy. For those that manage to succeed, people tend to go from calling you crazy, to heroic. This is especially true if you manage to get points for rescuing (or picking up) girls, killing stuff, and collecting treasure.

203106.name: Necker
203106.description:
Necker is an abstract strategy game published in a limited 120 handcrafted production. It’s gameplay is based on abstract classic Backgammon. The board uses Necker Cube optical illusion giving the players the sense of each climbing a pyramid though they are all moving in different directions.
Each player starts with 5 pieces on the base of the pyramid, having to climb to the top in order to win. First player reaching the top of the pyramid wins the game. Each turn players must roll 2 dice which can show “advance” or “change” 1 or more pieces. Then the player must choose one of them and perform the actions. Advance mean going “up” in the current pyramid the pieces are on, change means the piece will move in other color pyramid, being then able to take other player pieces but not climbing to win the game. A taken piece goes to the base of it’s color.

203107.name: Godsrealm
203107.description:
From the game:

To begin play as a PC you need to make a god. There are three simple steps to making a god - your archetypes, your domains, and your character. Note that you don't have to go down these like a list. You can easily make the character of your god and pick archetypes and domains that fit their concept, or pick your favorite domains then backtrack to find archetypes that would allow you to have both of them.

Note that Godsrealm does not have character sheets like most other role playing games. This is because the system is both so overwhelming simple that character sheets are redundant, while also being so complex no one sheet of paper could encompass it. For instance, a level one character has quite literally four things to write on their character sheet most of the time, not including a description of their god. However, an established god must try to keep up with all of their races, what they have created and uncreated etc. As such, it’s best to just have a couple of sheets of paper to take notes as the game goes on.

203108.description:
Set of 5 hand-painted wooden pawns 28x15mm for the game Pandemic.

Each pawn is for one of the roles in the game (and replaces the existing pawn).

Unusual and high-quality wooden game pieces. Hand painted with oil paint and sealed with spar varnish for long durability. The pieces have a size of 28x15 mm.
203108.name: Pandemic: Set of Pawns for Roles

203109.name: PulseCharge
203109.description:
User Summary

In this 2D platformer, you can store an enemy attack and use it in any direction you want.

203110.name: Ascension X: War of Shadows – Chaos Rider
203110.description: Ascension X: War of Shadows – Chaos Rider is a promotional card that carries a dual cost, grants you three power, and allows you to return a Void card from your discard pile to your hand.

203120.name: Hand of Fate (2013)
203120.description:
User summary:

All phases of game play depend upon random card draws from a Tarot deck. This begins with character creation, proceeds to setting development, and includes a series of events that occur in the game. Action resolution likewise uses card draws.

203121.name: Dark Deeds: Gamemonger
203121.description: The Gamemonger promotional card was included in issue 196 of Game Trade Magazine. The Gamemonger is a green Merchant with a base roll value of 6.

203122.name: Battle for Vedros: Starter Set
203122.description:
Battle for Vedros is a skirmish tabletop miniatures game that utilizes the models of Warhammer 40,000. The rules of the game are similar to the Warhammer 40,000 game but have been simplified to appeal to younger players. The models in the starter set are compatible with Warhammer 40,000; in fact, it reuses half of the sprue molds designed for 2008's Warhammer 40,000 Fifth Edition starter set named Assault on Black Reach (for almost the same MSRP as the latter's – 83% ohn and 75% with inflation).

The starter set contains:

1 Space Marine Captain
6 Tactical Space Marines
1 Space Marine Terminator
1 Space Marine Dreadnought
1 Ork Warboss
5 Ork Nobz
12 Ork Boyz
1 Ork Deffkopta
1 Battle for Vedros rulebook
8 Dice




The six expansion packs are repackagings of selected Fifth Edition unit packs (with no change in price).

203124.description:
Expansion for Massive Darkness containing:

3 Hero miniatures (Ajax the Sorcerer, Sarah the High Elf and Silence the Thief);
1 Roaming Monster Creature (Lord Tusk);
5 Cards;
1 Class sheet pad.
203124.name: Massive Darkness: Heroes & Monster Set – Sorcerers vs Lord Tusk

203125.name: Beneath the Floorboards
203125.description:
From the introduction:

For city dwellers, rats are a source of constant trouble. They get into food stores, spread disease, and some of the larger species have been known to be quite dangerous. But some rumors tell of rats that are more than just rats – they are more intelligent than their common brethren, capable of executing clever plans, and can even talk in common with tiny, hushed voices. Most consider these rumors too ridiculous to entertain, but the truth is even more strange.

User summary:

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters

203126.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #14 - Jun 2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
203126.description:
Sanctum Secorum

A complete adventure for your DCC RPG table!
The Jewels of Gwahlur

203127.name: The Faceless King
203127.description:
The Faceless King is a card game of hidden identities and deductive reasoning with a little insanity. Each player has 4 different identities that they can choose to use or not at their discretion, all for the primary purpose of determining who is the faceless king.

The Identities

The King - Functions as Assassin, Oracle, Magus, and Witch
The Magus - Can trade a card for another card between two players
The Oracle - Can make a player reveal a card and discard it
The Illusionist - Counters the Oracle
The Wizard - Can hide a card previously revealed.
The Witch - Can force another player to tell them if they have a certain card, cant ask if they have the King.
The Spectre - Can resurrect a new card to replace one lost.
The Knight - Counters the Assassin
The Assassin - Can Assassinate a specific card
The Monk - Counters The Spectre
The Ranger - Counters The Magus
The Undead King - Makes Offense Abilities Unblockable
The Bard - Counters The Witch

Before beginning play remove The King from the deck of cards, based on the number of players determine how many cards you need. Set aside that many cards minus 1. Place The King on the top of the deck and then shuffle the cards thoroughly. For example is you have 3 players you would shuffle and deal 11 cards face down then shuffle the King card into that. Deal the cards to each player from there.

Deal four cards to each player.

Players then each take a turn going around the table.

On their turn, they state an ability they wish to perform, based off one of the actions that the various cards can do. The player states “As a X i want to Y”, For example “As an assassin I want to assassinate your second from the left card”.

However if they do not have to have the card to successfully pull off the action. The targeted player can choose to call their “bluff” so to speak.

That player must reveal if he has the card or not. If the player does have the card the action goes through as normal, if they do not have the card they will lose 1 of their other cards as well.

The targeted player has repercussions as well if they accuse the player of bluffing and they are not, not only does the action go through as normal but they also lose an additional card.
On that same note the player who is targeted with an ability can also bluff and say they can block the action with appropriate card, however their bluff can be called out as well.

Or the may choose to pass. However once a card has been discarded its ability can no longer be used.

If The King is revealed or assassinated everyone but The King’s holder wins. If The King can outlast and outwit his opponents than he wins.

If all a players identities are revealed they are out of the game

203130.name: Shrek: SuperSlam
203130.description:
Shrek SuperSlam is 3D multiplayer fighting game. The game features three multiplayer modes: "King of the Hill", "Melee", and "Slammageddon".
In "King of the Hill", the object of the game is to stay atop of a hill the longest, while opponents try and knock each other off. The first player to reach 30 points wins. The longer the player stay on the hill, the more points she/he receive. In "Melee", the objective is to earn as many slam points within a 2-minute time period. For attack, a word bank that says "Slam" will fill up. Once the bank has filled up, the player can unleash a Slam Attack which can hit multiple opponents. For each opponent who's hit, the player will receive a Slam Point, but if a player get slammed, they'll lose one. The player with the most slam points after the time limit stops wins. In "Slammageddon", each single attack counts as a Slam. But, if a player manage to get a 'Max Slam Juice' potion in Slammageddon match and hit the opponent(s) with your slam, nothing happens.
Every character has a "Slam" attack. Slams all have different effects. For example, Shrek's Green Storm attack will send his opponents flying as he undergoes flatulence and Pinocchio's nose extends and he flies towards enemies in an attempt to strike them.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shrek_SuperSlam,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203131.name: Def Jam: Fight for NY – The Takeover
203131.description:
The game's story is a prequel to the events of Def Jam Vendetta. However, the game uses many of the same situations and characters from Fight for NY, which is the third game in the series, chronologically. The player is still a nameless up-and-coming young street fighter brought into the world of underground street fighting after rescuing one of the game's personalities from trouble with the police. However, instead of D-Mob being freed from police custody, like in Fight for NY, it is tattoo artist Manny who is saved from corrupt police officers. Manny takes the player to gang leader O.G., who becomes his "mentor", who instructs him in how to fight to gain control of (take over) the five boroughs of New York City. Eventually, O.G. is murdered by Crow, leaving D-Mob to step in and use the player as his number one fighter. Ultimately, it is revealed that D-Mob was using the player to take over the five boroughs, controlling New York City's underground, and that he was going to leave the player to take the fall, leading the police to his exact whereabouts. After defeating D-Mob in the story's final battle, a one-on-one fight at the 125th Street Subway Station, the player decides to leave the underground fight scene for good. It is safe to say that, since this is a prequel story, D-Mob recovers from the fight and, with nobody in New York to stop him, builds his empire that is seen in Vendetta.

Character creation is still the same as Fight for NY. Just like in the original, only male characters can be created. You still create your character using the same type of police sketch-artist system. A new addition is choosing your character's home town from one of the five boroughs of New York City. From there, the game flows similarly to Fight for NY, featuring many of the same fighting arenas and shops with which to upgrade your character's clothing, jewelry, hair, and fighting moves.

The story is no longer told through fully voiced cutscenes. For The Takeover, the story progresses through text and messages received on your character's Sidekick.

Also, since the game uses many of the graphical assets seen in 2004's Fight for NY, it does not reflect physical changes seen in some of the celebrities featured in the game. For example, Busta Rhymes, in the role of Magic, still has his dreadlock hairstyle, which he cut in late 2005. Also, Ludacris still has his cornrow hairstyle, which he would cut in the summer of 2006.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Def_Jam_Fight_for_NY:_The_Takeover," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203133.name: The Pinball Arcade: Season 2
videogamecompilation: Table Pack 11: Dr. Dude and His Excellent Ray and Firepower
Table Pack 12: Cactus Canyon and Central Park
Table Pack 13: White Water and Space Shuttle
Table Pack 15: The Champion Pub and Whirlwind
Table Pack 16: Flight 2000 and Goin' Nuts
Table Pack 18: Haunted House and Tee'd Off
Table Pack 19: Class of 1812 and Victory
Table Pack 20: Cue Ball Wizard and El Dorado City of Gold
203133.description:
User Summary

All the table packs from Season 2 of The Pinball Arcade are available here on a physical disc release. At the time of writing, this is the only way to own many of these tables as a physical release.

203134.name: Fighting Edition
203134.description: User Summary: A collection of three fighting games by Namco/Bandai on one disc: Tekken Tag Tournament 2, Tekken 6 (which turns Tekken Force from a mini-game to 25 stages), and Soulcalibur V.

203135.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. 4+ players may need stations.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also 6 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but you can travel by air for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: make two trips in one go for better points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
203135.name: Estonia (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

203136.description:
Völuspá: Longship is a five-tile expansion for the Völuspá base game or for the base game and Saga of Edda expansion.

Fill your longship with an epic crew of gods and creatures and plan a daring raid to victory.
203136.name: Völuspá: Longship

203137.name: Altered Beast (2005)
203137.description:
The story follows a man called Luke Custer who is a "Genome-Cyborg", a human whose DNA and other genetic make-up has been artificially altered allowing micro-chips containing the genetic make-up of other creatures to transform him into an anthropomorphic beast. After surviving a helicopter crash, Luke loses his memory and sets off to learn about the truth behind his past and the Genome-Cyborgs.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altered_Beast_(2005_video_game...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203138.name: Hard Rock Casino
203138.description: User summary: This is a casino game that includes table games, fruit machine games, poker rooms and a sports bar. Completing challenges unlocks items for your created character. Progressing in the game allows you access to tournaments and high-stakes areas.

203139.name: Dinomania
203139.description:
Dinomania is a strategic card game, which gets more and more intense with each card you play!

If playing 2-3 players, start with 7 cards, and if playing 4-6 players you start with 6 cards. The goal is to get rid of all your cards as fast as possible.

When a player has discarded all cards, the remaining players count the points in their hand. When a player reaches the maximum score (recommended max score: 73), the player with the lowest score wins.

Let the youngest start, or choose yourself (perhaps the one who needs the most help?) If you can’t, or don’t want to, play a card, you have to draw a card from the deck, and let the turn pass over to the next player. Beware of the T-rex! When the deck has no more cards, simply shuffle all the played cards and keep on going!

If the draw-deck is completely out of cards, no more cards are drawn! The T-rex card is worth 36 points! That can only happen with event cards, or by sabotaging a rival with for example the card “Give away 2 cards from your hand to another player”, or hope that someone else will draw the T-rex from your hand when they are playing the card “draw a card from another player”, and try to keep a poker face!

When you only have three cards left on your hand you have to scream out ”Dinomania”, your greatest Dino-roar, or just any sound to indicate your amount of cards. If you don’t - you get 10 points even if you win that gameplay.

203140.name: Homerun
203140.description: User summary: A baseball game featuring Japanese baseball teams.

203141.name: The Haunting of Billy
203141.description:
User Summary

Heavy on retro graphics, you start off with a tree branch, killing zombies and other monsters, slowly gaining weapons and items to make further progress through the dungeon.

203142.name: Motocross Mania 3
203142.description:
The game focuses on vehicular combat, and players can use various weapons such as baseball bats and ice picks to attack opponents.
